Submodules¶

qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.ae.ae module¶

The Amplitude Estimation Algorithm.

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.ae.ae.AmplitudeEstimation(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.algorithms.quantum_algorithm.QuantumAlgorithm

The Amplitude Estimation algorithm.

CONFIGURATION = {'defaults': {'uncertainty_model': {'name': 'NormalDistribution'}, 'iqft': {'name': 'STANDARD'}}, 'depends': ['uncertainty_problem', 'uncertainty_model', 'iqft'], 'description': 'Amplitude Estimation Algorithm', 'input_schema': {'$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/schema#', 'id': 'AmplitudeEstimation_schema', 'type': 'object', 'properties': {'num_eval_qubits': {'type': 'integer', 'default': 5, 'minimum': 1}}, 'additionalProperties': False}, 'name': 'AmplitudeEstimation', 'problems': ['uncertainty']}¶
SECTION_KEY_ALGORITHM = 'algorithm'¶
SECTION_KEY_FEATURE_MAP = 'feature_map'¶
SECTION_KEY_INITIAL_STATE = 'initial_state'¶
SECTION_KEY_IQFT = 'iqft'¶
SECTION_KEY_MULTICLASS_EXTENSION = 'multiclass_extension'¶
SECTION_KEY_OPTIMIZER = 'optimizer'¶
SECTION_KEY_ORACLE = 'oracle'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_MODEL = 'uncertainty_model'¶
SECTION_KEY_UNCERTAINTY_PROBLEM = 'uncertainty_problem'¶
SECTION_KEY_VAR_FORM = 'variational_form'¶
__init__(num_eval_qubits, a_factory, q_factory=None, iqft=None)[source]¶

Constructor.

Parameters:
  • num_eval_qubits (int) – number of evaluation qubits
  • a_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing the problem unitary
  • q_factory (CircuitFactory) – the CircuitFactory subclass object representing an amplitude estimation sample (based on a_factory)
  • iqft (IQFT) – the Inverse Quantum Fourier Transform pluggable component, defaults to using a standard iqft when None
static check_pluggable_valid()¶

Checks if pluggable is ready for use. Throws an exception if not

configuration¶

Return pluggable configuration.

construct_circuit()[source]¶

Construct the Amplitude Estimation quantum circuit.

Returns:the QuantumCircuit object for the constructed circuit
classmethod init_params(params, algo_input)[source]¶

Initialize via parameters dictionary and algorithm input instance :param params: parameters dictionary :param algo_input: Input instance

quantum_instance¶
random¶

Return a numpy random.

random_seed¶

Return random seed.

run(quantum_instance=None, **kwargs)¶

Execute the algorithm with selected backend.

Parameters:quantum_instance (QuantumInstance or BaseBackend) – the experiemental setting.
Returns:results of an algorithm.
Return type:dict

qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.ae.q_factory module¶

class qiskit_aqua.algorithms.single_sample.ae.q_factory.QFactory(a_factory)[source]¶

Bases: qiskit_aqua.utils.circuit_factory.CircuitFactory

build(qc, q, q_ancillas=None, params=None)[source]¶

Adds corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled(qc, q, q_control, q_ancillas=None, params=None)[source]¶

Adds corresponding controlled sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_control – control qubit
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled_inverse(qc, q, q_control, q_ancillas=None, params=None)[source]¶

Adds controlled inverse of corresponding sub-circuit to given circuit

Parameters:
  • qc – quantum circuit
  • q – list of qubits (has to be same length as self._num_qubits)
  • q_control – control qubit
  • q_ancillas – list of ancilla qubits (or None if none needed)
  • params – parameters for circuit
build_controlled_inverse_power(qc, q, q_control, power, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Adds controlled, inverse, power of corresponding circuit. May be overridden if a more efficient implementation is possible

build_controlled_power(qc, q, q_control, power, q_ancillas=None, params=None)¶

Adds controlled power of corresponding circuit. May be overridden if a more efficient implementation is possible
